p: All participants reflected on a strong tension regarding their concept of the role as a "professional ethicist.” This became particularly clear during the card sorting process in the interviews. Many of the participants developed concepts of a tense or contradictory nature. They reflected in detail on the tension between two poles. On the one hand, they described the concept of a neutral and "ethical” person who is equipped with knowledge on the medical context and philosophical theory. According to this, the professional's primary task is to detect and analyze ethical problems. Ethicists should take their own position based on their knowledge and skills.
